variables.description: Boolean if the styles for lists with icons should be included.
Boolean if the styles for lists with avatars should be included.
Boolean if the styles for lists with two lines of text should be included.
Boolean if the styles for lists with three lines of text should be included.
Boolean if the styles for lists with controls should be included.
A number for how much to increment the nested depth multiplier

The max depth for nested items in lists. This is used to generate
some additional padding on nested lists.

context.name: react-md-lists

parameter.name: light-theme
parameter.description:
Boolean if the lists should be styled
    for the light theme.

parameter.name: nested-items-depth
parameter.description:
The maximum depth for
    nested items.

parameter.name: nested-items-increment
parameter.description:
The amount the
    nested item's padding should be incremented by.

parameter.name: include-media
parameter.description:
Boolean if the media queries should
    be included.

parameter.name: include-icon
parameter.description:
Boolean if the styles for lists with
    icons should be included.

parameter.name: include-avatar
parameter.description:
Boolean if the styles for lists
    with avatars should be included.

parameter.name: include-two-lines
parameter.description:
Boolean if the styles for
    lists with two lines of text should be included.

parameter.name: include-three-lines
parameter.description:
Boolean if the styles for
    lists with three lines of text should be included.

parameter.name: include-controls
parameter.description:
Boolean if the styles for lists
    with controls to be included.

usedBy.description:
Includes every component, transition, and typography including their
media queries if the `$md-media-included` variable is `true`. You can
modify any global variables before including this mixin to change the overall
theme.

context.name: react-md-everything

mixins.description: Updates the theme for lists ONLY if the `$light-theme` does not equal the `$md-light-theme`.

parameter.name: light-theme
parameter.description:
Boolean if the lists should be themed by
    the light theme.

usedBy.description:
Updates the styles of every component with the new theme colors. If there
are components that do not change if the `$light-theme` variable is the same,
their updated styles will not be included. This is useful if you want to switch
between the light or dark theme, or even the entire theme colors while keeping
the base css the same between all themes.

In addition, if the theme colors do not switch, those styles will not be created.
So this allows the same colors between light and dark themes.

If you switch between the light and dark theme, you will need to give a `$html-class-name`
That will nest every component inside.

context.name: react-md-theme-everything

mixins.description:
Creates the styles for nested lists. It basically loops over the `$nested-items-depth` param
and adds `padding-left` to each nested list equal to the
`$md-list-left-padding * (1 + $depth * $nested-items-increment)`.

parameter.name: nested-items-depth
parameter.description: The maximum depth for nested lists.

parameter.name: nested-items-increment
parameter.description:
The amount that the
    nested list's padding should be incremented at each step.

context.name: react-md-lists
